Articles.Content:
Hello y'all!

So, recently, I decided to get back into cinematic making. I'm not sure if I want to continue in that direction.

This little beauty is the culmination of about two days of work. It ain't wonderful: The Kerbals repeat themselves again... and again... and again. (I cut all of the audio off of a thirty-second clip from a long time ago.) Note that the entire video was done in stock KSP, with no camera mods. (Though I think you can tell. ) ...and I left out music.

Do you think I should continue making cinematics, for the sake of Science, or cease making them forever?

Incidentally, I put this cinematic here because I view it as heavily edited enough to be considered animation. If moderators think this should go in "Live from Mission Control," feel free to put it there.

Thanks!

Depends whether you enjoyed the making and were just frustrated with the result, or whether the making was a chore!

For what it's worth, I think you're being a bit harsh on yourself. The kerbal voices weren't great as you say but the camera-work was good, it was well put together and I liked the camera effects (glitches during launch, extra information popping up around the edges of the screen etc.) very much. It had a real 'live from space' feeling.
